intro: Ascalonicum, commonly known as the Spanish bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped or tubular flowers, which are typically blue or violet in color. The plants are native to southern Europe and western Asia, often growing in rocky or limestone soils. Ascalonicum species are perennial herbs with opposite, ovate leaves and showy inflorescences. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
